hint: We hurt without moving. We poison without touching. We bear the truth and the lies. We are not to be judged by our size.
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you haven’t got me.
I can travel around the world while staying in a corner.
I have keys but no locks. I have a space but no room. You can enter, but can’t go outside.
Without fingers, I point, without arms, I strike, without feet, I run.
The more of this there is, the less you see.
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk or leaves.
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same.
I have a head and a tail, but I don’t have a body.
Poor people have it. Rich people need it. If you eat it, you die.
